meanings.definition: To remove a covering or wrapping from something.
meanings.sent1: She carefully unswathed the gift to see what was inside.
meanings.sent2: The caterpillar unswathed itself from the cocoon and emerged as a butterfly.
meanings.sent3: The magician unswathed the mysterious box to reveal a fluffy bunny inside.
meanings.sent4: As the fog lifted, the valley was unswathed in a blanket of sunlight.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, she unswathed the bandage to check the wound.

meanings.definition: To reveal or expose something that was previously hidden or covered.
meanings.sent1: The detective unswathed the truth behind the mysterious disappearance.
meanings.sent2: The artist unswathed his latest masterpiece at the gallery opening.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was unswathed when the lights suddenly turned on.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unswathed the beauty that was hidden beneath her serious expression.
meanings.sent5: The sunrise unswathed the breathtaking view of the mountains in the distance.
